intro: Stutzeria callicomoides, commonly known as the sweet-scented stutzeria, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its fragrant, small white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a glossy texture. Stutzeria callicomoides is typically found in humid, shaded environments within its native habitat.
